intro: Chamaefistula antillana, commonly known as the Antillean boxwood, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and have a leathery texture, while the flowers are usually yellow or orange in color. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal environments.
